lines.code: """Utility functions to use with the wordnet module.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # (First 10) adjectives that are transitively SIMILAR to the main sense of 'red'
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: ['red' in {adjective: red, reddish, ruddy, blood-red, carmine, cerise, cherry, cherry-red, crimson, ruby, ruby-red, scarlet}, {adjective: chromatic}, {adjective: amber, brownish-yellow, yellow-brown}, {adjective: amethyst}, {adjective: aureate, gilded, gilt, gold, golden}, {adjective: azure, cerulean, sky-blue, bright blue}, {adjective: blue, bluish, blueish, light-blue, dark-blue, blue-black}, {adjective: bluish green, blue-green, cyan, teal}, {adjective: blushful, rosy}, {adjective: bottle-green}]
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: >>> # Adjectives that are transitively SIMILAR to any of the senses of 'red'
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: >>> # Hyponyms of the main sense of 'dog'(n.) that are homophonous with verbs
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: ['dog' in {noun: dog, domestic dog, Canis familiaris}, 'pooch' in {noun: pooch, doggie, doggy, barker, bow-wow}, 'toy' in {noun: toy dog, toy}, 'hound' in {noun: hound, hound dog}, 'basset' in {noun: basset, basset hound}, 'cocker' in {noun: cocker spaniel, English cocker spaniel, cocker}, 'bulldog' in {noun: bulldog, English bulldog}]
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: >>> # Find the senses of 'raise'(v.) and 'lower'(v.) that are antonyms
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: >>> filter(lambda p:p[0] in p[1].pointerTargets(ANTONYM), product(V['raise'].getSenses(), V['lower'].getSenses()))
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: [('raise' in {verb: raise, lift, elevate, get up, bring up}, 'lower' in {verb: lower, take down, let down, get down, bring down})]
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: raise TypeError(`entity` + " is not a Sense or Synset.  Try " + `entity` + "[0] instead.")
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: raise TypeError(`entity` + " is not a Sense or Synset")
lines.author: tom@organisms.be

lines.code: ['dog' in {noun: dog, domestic dog, Canis familiaris},
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: [{noun: placental, placental mammal, eutherian, eutherian mammal},
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: [{noun: animal, animate being, beast, brute, creature, fauna},
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: >>> #pprint(tree(dog, HYPONYM)) # too verbose to include here
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Return the transitive closure of source under the pointerType
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: relationship.  If source is a Word, return the union of the
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: ['dog' in {noun: dog, domestic dog, Canis familiaris}, {noun: canine, canid}, {noun: carnivore}, {noun: placental, placental mammal, eutherian, eutherian mammal}, {noun: mammal}, {noun: vertebrate, craniate}, {noun: chordate}, {noun: animal, animate being, beast, brute, creature, fauna}, {noun: organism, being}, {noun: living thing, animate thing}, {noun: object, physical object}, {noun: entity}]
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return reduce(union, map(lambda s, t=pointerType:tree(s,t), source.getSenses()))
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Return source and its hyponyms.  If source is a Word, return
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: the union of the hyponyms of its senses."""
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Return source and its hypernyms.  If source is a Word, return
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: the union of the hypernyms of its senses."""
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Return the meet of a and b under the pointerType relationship.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Return true iff a and b have the same lowercase representation.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: # test a == b first as an optimization where they're equal
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return a == b or string.lower(a) == string.lower(b)
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Return true iff _item_ is a Sequence (a List, String, or Tuple).
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Return the Cartesian product of u and v.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return flatten1(map(lambda a, v=v:map(lambda b, a=a:(a,b), v), u))
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Return a copy of _sequence_ with equal items removed.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: [{noun: message, content, subject matter, substance}, None, {noun: abstraction}, {noun: communication}]
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Search for _form_ in the index file corresponding to
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: _pos_. getIndex applies to _form_ an algorithm that replaces
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: underscores with hyphens, hyphens with underscores, removes
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: hyphens and underscores, and removes periods in an attempt to find
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: a form of the string that is an exact match for an entry in the
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: index file corresponding to _pos_.  getWord() is called on each
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: transformed string until a match is found or all the different
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: strings have been tried. It returns a Word or None."""
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: def trySubstitutions(trySubstitutions, form, substitutions, lookup=1, dictionary=dictionaryFor(pos)):
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: substitute = string.replace(form, old, new) and substitute != form
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: return              trySubstitutions(trySubstitutions, form, substitutions[1:], lookup=0) or \
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: """Recursively uninflect _form_, and return the first form found
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: in the dictionary.  If _collect_ is true, a sequence of all forms
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f

lines.code: is returned, instead of just the first one.
lines.author: tomdesmedt@gmail.com@b69ec992-5447-3b6c-d919-7ed00d13665f
